prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The final shape has dimensions of approximately 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 3 units high, with parallel sides that meet at right angles. To construct the first part: 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw the first face of the prism by creating a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should be a rectangle with four lines. The first line should start at [0.0, 0.0] and end at [0.66, 0.0]. The second line should start at [0.66, 0.0] and end at [0.66, 0.75]. The third line should start at [0.66, 0.75] and end at [0.0, 0.75]. The fourth line should start at [0.0, 0.75] and end at [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees around the Z, Y, and X axes, respectively, and translating it by [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 5. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.36 units in the negative normal direction. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The final shape has dimensions of approximately 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 3 units high, with parallel sides that meet at right angles. To construct the second part: 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to [0.063, 0.0, 0.09]. 2. Draw the first face of the prism by creating a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should be a rectangle with four lines. The first line should start at [0.0, 0.0] and end at [0.534, 0.0]. The second line should start at [0.534, 0.0] and end at [0.534, 0.66]. The third line should start at [0.534, 0.66] and end at [0.0, 0.66]. The fourth line should start at [0.0, 0.66] and end at [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.66. 4. Transform the sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees around the Z, Y, and X axes, respectively, and translating it by [0.063, 0.0, 0.09]. 5. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.18 units in the negative normal direction, which will cut the material from the previous part.</description>
